item.title: [DISTRELEC-6093] Alternate links are causing a language change
item.description:
I found the reason for our problem with the language changes (see DISTRELEC-5648).
In the HTML header we display some SEO alternate links:

<link rel="alternate" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/search" hreflang="x-default" />
<link rel="alternate" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/en/search" hreflang="en-ch" />
<link rel="alternate" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/de/search" hreflang="de-ch" />
<link rel="alternate" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/fr/search" hreflang="fr-ch" />

For some reason (I currently don't know why) there are browsers that call these URLs and therefore change their language in the session.

I have found such examples in the Apache access log (with IE10 and Chrome37):

193.246.92.244 - - [29/Dec/2014:07:20:46 +0100] "www.distrelec.ch" "GET /search?q=micro+USB HTTP/1.0" 200 214644  "http://www.distrelec.ch/" "Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 10.0; Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/6.0)" 1399213
193.246.92.244 - - [29/Dec/2014:07:20:47 +0100] "www.distrelec.ch" "GET /fr/search HTTP/1.0" 200 77877  "http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q=micro+USB" "Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 10.0; Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/6.0)" 80024
193.246.92.244 - - [29/Dec/2014:07:20:47 +0100] "www.distrelec.ch" "GET /search HTTP/1.0" 200 107043  "http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q=micro+USB" "Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 10.0; Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/6.0)" 98029
193.246.92.244 - - [29/Dec/2014:07:20:47 +0100] "www.distrelec.ch" "GET /en/search HTTP/1.0" 200 107059  "http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q=micro+USB" "Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 10.0; Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/6.0)" 106619
193.246.92.244 - - [29/Dec/2014:07:20:47 +0100] "www.distrelec.ch" "GET /de/search HTTP/1.0" 200 107059  "http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q=micro+USB" "Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 10.0; Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/6.0)" 106808
...
193.246.92.244 - - [29/Dec/2014:07:24:52 +0100] "www.distrelec.ch" "GET /search?q=micro+USB&page=5&pageSize=10 HTTP/1.0" 200 213375  "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/37.0.2062.120 Safari/537.36" 360955
193.246.92.244 - - [29/Dec/2014:07:24:53 +0100] "www.distrelec.ch" "GET /fr/search HTTP/1.0" 200 61527  "http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q=micro+USB&page=5&pageSize=10" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/37.0.2062.120 Safari/537.36" 255608
193.246.92.244 - - [29/Dec/2014:07:24:53 +0100] "www.distrelec.ch" "GET /search HTTP/1.0" 200 61518  "http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q=micro+USB&page=5&pageSize=10" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/37.0.2062.120 Safari/537.36" 257124
193.246.92.244 - - [29/Dec/2014:07:24:53 +0100] "www.distrelec.ch" "GET /en/search HTTP/1.0" 200 61521  "http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q=micro+USB&page=5&pageSize=10" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/37.0.2062.120 Safari/537.36" 256622
193.246.92.244 - - [29/Dec/2014:07:24:53 +0100] "www.distrelec.ch" "GET /de/search HTTP/1.0" 200 99983  "http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q=micro+USB&page=5&pageSize=10" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/37.0.2062.120 Safari/537.36" 295500

However, I'm not able to reproduce the bug.
item.summary: Alternate links are causing a language change

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
We should ASAP take care about this problem.
Possible solution: Maybe we can show these links only to "Googlebot". Pierre can hopefully decide whether this is OK.

Hi Pierre,
We have to solve this issues.
Is it ok from your side if we only show these links to Google?

Hi Florian & Adrian,

Indeed, the access log have spoken... (I found the same).
Apparently webkit an IE Browser are prefetching url inside <link> tags without request of the user,
which is forcing a new language on the fly depending on the last language dedicated <link> called.

On my side it's ok to show alternate links only to bots.

Perfect,
Adrian could you please take care of it?

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6073] Ariba // Automated form submit
item.description: Use terrific module for automated form submit for OCI/ARIBA CXML pages.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Please test after the next deployment.
Thanks!

Future Improvement: Add loading icon

Now we get an error 500 during the check out with Ariba/OCI interfaces.

You can test with:
https://www.distrelec.ch/ociEntry?username=webmaster@distrelec.com&password=123456&hook_url=http://q08.elfa.se:50000/elfa3/catalogdb/DisplayParametersServlet&oci_version=4.0

After some investigation I found the following issue:

janv. 05, 2015 10:57:21 AM org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationDispatcher invoke
SEVERE: Servlet.service() for servlet jsp threw exception
org.apache.jasper.JasperException: /WEB-INF/views/desktop/pages/terrific/eprocurement/ociPage.jsp(18,1) No tag "eproc-success" defined in tag library imported with prefix "mod"
        at org.apache.jasper.compiler.DefaultErrorHandler.jspError(DefaultErrorHandler.java:40)
        at org.apache.jasper.compiler.ErrorDispatcher.dispatch(ErrorDispatcher.java:407)
        at org.apache.jasper.compiler.ErrorDispatcher.jspError(ErrorDispatcher.java:198)
        at org.apache.jasper.compiler.Parser.parseCustomTag(Parser.java:1187)
        at org.apache.jasper.compiler.Parser.parseElementsScriptless(Parser.java:1473)
        at org.apache.jasper.compiler.Parser.parseBody(Parser.java:1639)
        at org.apache.jasper.compiler.Parser.parseOptionalBody(Parser.java:978)
        at org.apache.jasper.compiler.Parser.parseCustomTag(Parser.java:1246)
        at org.apache.jasper.compiler.Parser.parseElements(Parser.java:1424)
        at org.apache.jasper.compiler.Parser.parse(Parser.java:130)
        at org.apache.jasper.compiler.ParserController.doParse(ParserController.java:255)
        at org.apache.jasper.compiler.ParserController.parse(ParserController.java:103)
        at org.apache.jasper.compiler.Compiler.generateJava(Compiler.java:185)
        at org.apache.jasper.compiler.Compiler.compile(Compiler.java:354)
        at org.apache.jasper.compiler.Compiler.compile(Compiler.java:334)
        at org.apache.jasper.compiler.Compiler.compile(Compiler.java:321)
        at org.apache.jasper.JspCompilationContext.compile(JspCompilationContext.java:592)
        at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServletWrapper.service(JspServletWrapper.java:328)
        at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.serviceJspFile(JspServlet.java:313)
        at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.service(JspServlet.java:260)
        at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:717)

this means that the tag "eproc-success" used in the file "ociPage.jsp" does not exist.
FE issue fixed by committing missing files
The customer just gave me the feedback, the auto redirect is still not working.

Please test again after the next deployment.
Thanks

Ruben,
This is still not working.
Please check this again.

Submission of the first element of the array obtained. Which should contain the actual form.

$('form[name="AribaOrderForm"]')[0]

Added console.logs to ease the debugging.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5989] EE - MwSt should not be calculated for B2B
item.description:
MOVEX SHOPS CZ/HU/SK/RO Issue
Business-customers get charged with MwSt. this is not correct.

Requirement (by Peter Szuchomelli) Verified:

  1. If the customer is a business-customer then tax should NOT be charged & shown.
  2. If the customer is a private-customer then tax should be charged & shown.

Note: This is NOT valid for AT.
item.summary: EE - MwSt should not be calculated for B2B

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Is the pricing not done by SAP?
Please check everything related to the Movex (without taxes etc.)

Adjusted specification.
@Will: These are Movex-Based countries therefore no SAP connection yet.
@Flo: Robert Spittaler said they don't have to change anything in Movex as they already don't charge mwst for b2b-customers in those countries.
Ok. I check the movex case.
Implemented new flag on website to turn on/off tax calculation for B2B checkout in each country.

commited in v3.1. ready for test deployment. what needs to be tested:

  • b2c checkout process
  • b2b checkout process -> turn on/off tax calculation flag in hmc on website
  • movex order export job

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5494] BE: ID-amendment
item.description:
BE-task as discussed with R. Husi. Please assign accordingly. The required technical BE-tasks were to be specified by R. Husi if an implementation were not done by him personally.

The specified ID (in this regard please compare the .doc-file at DISTRELEC-4772) shall be amended and provided to the FE as following (applying for 'new' products accordingly):

  • Clearance (Sale): -cre
  • New: -new

All cases that are specified in the .doc-file attached at DISTRELEC-4772 shall thereby be covered accordingly.

In case that the ID cannot be amended from a BE-perspective, Ruben would need to be instructed on how a published a product can be 'assigned' to 'Clearance' or 'New' from a FE-perspective.

Thanks! Mark

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: please review

Verified today on distrelec.ch (v3.1.11). Not implemented as specified - compare the two attached screenshots in this regard (referring to 'new' products). The implementation for Clearance-products (Sale) are also not implemented accordingly.

Please verify and refactor.
Please review.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3799] Tracking Onsite-Links
item.description:
Referring to 'left-side navigation', 'icons', 'facetted search' and 'main navigation'.

To be implemented as specified in the attached .doc-file

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hello Florian,
this task is mainly FE work.
Please review the Sprint,
Thanks!

FE done, but is some BE work to do.

According to the .doc file attached, the parameter "wtTeaserTrackingId" must be:

1.1.- [countryCode].ons.lnv
1.2.- [countryCode].ons.ico
1.3.- [countryCode].faf-s.fct
1.4.- [countryCode].ons.mnv

NOTE:

  • "List import" is a CMS component
  • "mod-impression" is a CMS component (1.4 in the doc, the links at the footer, bottom right corner)

Please assign to BE, and back to me for local testing.
Thanks

Hi Ruben,

BE stuff is done and ready for testing. Assigning it back to you

Local tests on DE:

1.1. de.ons.lnv
NOK. name="de.ons.ico.mechanische-komponenten.-" (to be corrected at BE side)

1.2. de.ons.ico
OK. name="de.ons.ico.mechanische-komponenten.-"

1.3. de.faf-s.fct
NOK name="de.faf-s.fct.c-usb-speicher-/speicherkarten/datenträger. (corrected at FE side, waiting for the end of code freeze to commit)

1.4. de.ons.mnv

  • Login/logout: OK.
  • List import: NOK --> CMS component
  • Mega flyout: OK. name="de.ons.mnv.industrial-ethernet.-"
  • Footer: OK name="de.ons.mnv.faq.-"
  • Impressum: NOK --> CMS component

Hi Neeraj,
can you have a look to the remaining NOK tests please?
Thanks

Hi Neeraj

We spoke about this via Lync a few weeks ago. We agreed that some BE-implementations are not as specified. You mentioned that you were going to fix these in due time accordingly. So far however this ticket has still had an Approved-status. Have you already done some further implementations? - FYI: According to a short cross-check many implementations require refactoring. Please verify all implementations for every Hybris webshop-country and advise.
In addition there are implementation enhancements which were not specified and should be reversed: Carpet-items do now additionally wrongly contain 'mnv' in the corresponding ID (compare I.png attached). Product-listing items now additionally wrongly contain 'ico' in the corresponding ID (compare I.png attached).

Thx Mark

Hi Mark,

I along with ruben figured out some big problem with current implementation of webtrekk. And we are sure that was the reason why tracking information were wrong.
However to correct them all needs a lot of re-factoring specially on front end side, we are on that phase right now and soon we will start testing.
Sorry for inconveniences caused by the issue. We will update you as soon as we are ready for testing.

Thanks

Front End refactoring done.

Remaining issue:

The parameter "wtTeaserTrackingId" should not contain "mnv". Because this parameter is used in many places.

It must be as it was before. Example "ch.ons", not "ch.ons.mnv".
Neeraj Shandilya | Distrelec Could you please have a look?
Thanks
Back End done too

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3649] Modify image gallery
item.description:
Feedback from: jan.kroeni@distrelec.com

When in Lightbox view, it is not shown how many pictures there are to see. Additionally, when there is more than 1 picture, the blue 'back' and 'next' buttons are always visible. You have to hover over the button to realize, that there is no more picture. Proposal: Don't show the back arrow on the first picture and respectively, don't show the next arrow on the last picture. Additionally, you could list the picture number out of the whole number at the bottom (see attached pics)

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: From what I can tell the functionality is actually already as described. Suggest closing this ticket.

Image counter added, please test after the next deployment
Thanks

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4594] SEO - URL Duplications Issues - Between m.distrelec.ch and www.distrelec.ch - canonical and alternate to add
item.description:
Observations :

  • Distrelec.ch, have a mobile website alternative m.distrelec.ch accessible and indexed by crawlers.
    --Desktop version :
    http://www.distrelec.ch/fr/Charge-%C3%A9lectronique-80-V-320-W-Aim-TTi-LD300/p/16985014
    --Mobile version :
    http://m.distrelec.ch/fr/Charge-%C3%A9lectronique-80-V-320-W-Aim-TTi-LD300/p/16985014

Impacts :

  • This situation create pure DUST (Different URLs, Similar Text) duplicate when not specified to crawlers.
  • That lead into major duplication of content, waste of crawl and finally not be ranked properly inside the search engine result pages.

Demands :

  • All website pages must have a tag that lead to their alternative absolute url path in the html head :
    • On http://m.distrelec.ch/* 
      <meta name="robots" content="index, follow, noodp, noydir">
<link rel="canonical" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/*" />

      Exemple with http://m.distrelec.ch/fr/Charge-%C3%A9lectronique-80-V-320-W-Aim-TTi-LD300/p/16985014 :

      <meta name="robots" content="index, follow, noodp, noydir">
<link rel="canonical" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/fr/Charge-%C3%A9lectronique-80-V-320-W-Aim-TTi-LD300/p/16985014" />
    • On http://www.distrelec.ch/* 
      <meta name="robots" content="index, follow, noodp, noydir">
<link rel="alternate" media="only screen and (max-width: 960px)" href="http://m.distrelec.ch/*" />
<link rel="alternate" media="handheld" href="http://m.distrelec.ch/*" />

      Exemple with http://www.distrelec.ch/fr/Charge-%C3%A9lectronique-80-V-320-W-Aim-TTi-LD300/p/16985014 :

      <meta name="robots" content="index, follow, noodp, noydir">
<link rel="alternate" media="only screen and (max-width: 960px)" href="http://m.distrelec.ch/fr/Charge-%C3%A9lectronique-80-V-320-W-Aim-TTi-LD300/p/16985014" />
<link rel="alternate" media="handheld" href="http://m.distrelec.ch/fr/Charge-%C3%A9lectronique-80-V-320-W-Aim-TTi-LD300/p/16985014" />

Checking process :

  • This issue can't be closed without my final live check.
  • Thank you to update the status of the implementation in the comment below.
item.summary: SEO - URL Duplications Issues - Between m.distrelec.ch and www.distrelec.ch - canonical and alternate to add

status.description: This issue was once resolved, but the resolution was deemed incorrect. From here issues are either marked assigned or resolved.

comments.comment:
@ Surendra: Could you please take care of the web site part.
@ Rafi Burlet: Please give the mobile part to Sevenval

Hallo Pierre-Francois,

Based on the above specification, I would like to put some question to you.

For all URI which follows after www.distrelec.ch/* must have link
<link rel="alternate" media”only screen and (max-width: 920px)” href="http://m.distrelec.ch/*" />

For URI which has http://www.distrelec.ch/[language]/[catagory]/p/product_code must have
<link rel="alternate" media="only screen and (max-width: 640px)" href="http://m.distrelec.ch/[language]/[catagory]/p/product_code />
<link rel="alternate" media="handheld" href="http://m.distrelec.ch/[language]/[catagory]/p/product_code />

What about the URI which has categories? Why you need different media query for different URIs?

Hi Surendra,

I'm not sure I understand your question.

But, for the category URI pattern it's the same thing, exemple :

  • Mobile website : 
    http://m.distrelec.ch/fr/Outils-et-mesure/Instruments-de-mesure/Oscilloscopes/Oscilloscopes-num%C3%A9riques-%C3%A0-m%C3%A9moire/Oscilloscopes%2C-Agilent-DSO1000B/c/cat-485635

    Html head must contain :

    <meta name="robots" content="index, follow, noodp, noydir">
<link rel="canonical" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/fr/Outils-et-mesure/Instruments-de-mesure/Oscilloscopes/Oscilloscopes-num%C3%A9riques-%C3%A0-m%C3%A9moire/Oscilloscopes%2C-Agilent-DSO1000B/c/cat-485635" />
  • www website : 
    http://www.distrelec.ch/fr/Outils-et-mesure/Instruments-de-mesure/Oscilloscopes/Oscilloscopes-num%C3%A9riques-%C3%A0-m%C3%A9moire/Oscilloscopes%2C-Agilent-DSO1000B/c/cat-485635

    Html head must contain : 

    <meta name="robots" content="index, follow, noodp, noydir">
<link rel="alternate" media="only screen and (max-width: 640px)" href="http://m.distrelec.ch/fr/Outils-et-mesure/Instruments-de-mesure/Oscilloscopes/Oscilloscopes-num%C3%A9riques-%C3%A0-m%C3%A9moire/Oscilloscopes%2C-Agilent-DSO1000B/c/cat-485635" />
<link rel="alternate" media="handheld" href="http://m.distrelec.ch/fr/Outils-et-mesure/Instruments-de-mesure/Oscilloscopes/Oscilloscopes-num%C3%A9riques-%C3%A0-m%C3%A9moire/Oscilloscopes%2C-Agilent-DSO1000B/c/cat-485635" />

And the same for any URI pattern 

*/c/cat-L[0-9]+*D*, */c/cat-DC[0-9]+*, */c/cat-[0-9]+*,*/manufacturer/*, /p/[0-9]+*....

If it doesn't answer your question, give me an URI exemple.

Thx
The task is completed and it will be deployed on Monday(22.09) or on Tuesday(23.09).
Not live on m or www.

Hi Pierre,

Sorry. The mobile version will be done by Sevenval.

Raphael is taking care of this issues.

Ok thanks !

When the desktop version on www.distrelec.com is planned to be deployed ?

Hi.
On the month of November.
Ticket@sevenval: https://projects.sevenval.com/issues/81610

- www.distrelec.ch part is live :

distrelec.ch/en/Tools-%26-Measurement/Panel-Meters/Analogue-Panel-Meters/c/cat-L3D_532322
<link rel="alternate" href="http://m.distrelec.ch/en/Tools-%26-Measurement/Panel-Meters/Analogue-Panel-Meters/c/cat-L3D_532322" media="only screen and (max-width: 640px)"  />
<link rel="alternate" href="http://m.distrelec.ch/en/Tools-%26-Measurement/Panel-Meters/Analogue-Panel-Meters/c/cat-L3D_532322" media="handheld"  />
